title: Lettering reference help
content:
Hello,  
I'm currently attempting to hand letter a logo based off of some faint visual memories of some mid-century modern lettering I've seen through my travels. I'm hoping someone out there can look at what I have so far and point me to some existing typefaces or lettering that evoke this "style" so I may reference them to perfect the whole thing!  
I would also love some general feedback and guidance if people are willing to share it!  
Thanks!  
James

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322044519im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fiftyfifty_6028.png)
author: jvankriedt

comments.content: Not exactly what you are asking but this is reminiscent of some of the patterns from the fashion company Orla Kiely.
Why is |Y| shorter than the rest?
I also notice that it takes a while to realize that one is supposed to be reading the black. At first looks I was trying to read the whites and accordingly seeing them as patterns not letters . . .

Yes, and this reminds me of the famous read black or white optical illusion:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322044519im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FaceOrVaseSM_3696.jpg)
  
Don

Thanks for the info everyone...  
I've played around with it some and found the optical illusion to be quite effective to help create this...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322044519im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fiftyfifty2_4176.png)
You may find some of the merchandise from House Industries of inspiration: [http://www.houseind.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322044519/http:/www.houseind.com/ "http://www.houseind.com")

Of interest, I stumbled upon this: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/undt/pills/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322044519/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/undt/pills/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/undt/pills/")
